author: Abraham Lincoln
content: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
Never promise more than you can perform.
author: Publilius Syrus

content: Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
author: Agatha Christie

content: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

content: We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others, by their acts.
author: Harold Nicolson
P. G. Wodehouse
content: To find a man's true character, play golf with him.
Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

content: Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
author: Carl Sagan

content: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
author: Harvey Mackay
Alan Watts
content: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.
I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.
author: Walter Cronkite

content: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
author: Melody Beattie
Mia Hamm
content: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.
We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Adversity causes some men to break, others to break records.
author: William Arthur Ward
